intro: Irenea myriantha, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its heart-shaped, velvety leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is known for its mucilaginous properties. It often grows in moist, shaded environments and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ecological and horticultural study.
